title: Between Two Turrets - Come chat with Saiyaka! [COMPLETE]
body:
http://i.imgur.com/oU1ol2p.jpg

_Welcome to the latest installment of Between Two Turrets, a new Q&A series from the NA Community team in which we'll connect you with various Rioters to chat about League, life, and anything in between. You can expect an installment every couple weeks or so, with Rioters from all over jumping in to spend some time with you on the boards._

_This week, we've got visual designer and classical vocalist (that's her in the Diana login music) **Saiyaka**!_

-----

**EDIT - Alright I'm heading back to work guys, thanks for all the questions! I'll try to check back over the next couple days in case any of you have more questions.**

Hi there! I’m Lisa and I’m a Visual Designer. Sometimes I sing, make funny voices and always fail at beatboxing.

I’m a classically trained vocalist, and from time to time have the opportunity to work with the music team on a number of League of Legends pieces like Diana’s theme - Daylight’s End, Orb of Winter from the Pentakill album, The Freljord theme and one of my favorites - Demacia Rising. 

As a visual designer, I work on layout, composition and building style guides for the web experiences of everything from the Urfitational to more serious events like Shurima. 

My favorite champ is Vayne. I’m currently playing Final Fantasy XIV - Hyperion server :3 I love classical music and good web design. I’m always looking for new music for my daily commute, playing League or just to listen, so send me your favorites~

I keep up with a small [music blog](http://www.boldlyclassic.com/#classic-magazine) and post some of my League and non-League related music projects up on my [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2hlzaTkdHTD9XxcZWdTpEw). Looking forward to chatting about design, travel or random music recommendations!

Lisa, “Saiyaka”

My favorite project as a Visual Designer would be the Shurima website. There were a lot really new and interesting things we tried and a lot of really great opportunities to stress out the web developer I worked with. 

As far as challenges, I'm in a little known ranked team, by the name of Teenage Mutant Ninja Tabi. We've recently entered Bronze 1 - A team best. Everyday is a challenge. However, the biggest challenge is having to explain why the name is just HILARIOUS. I mean... come on... It's like Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, but it's Ninja Tabi, which is an item in the game - a premium play on words.

My question is: What brought you in to LoL and how long have you been with Riot Gaming as a visual designer (or with Riot in general)?

P.S. Sorry about my vulgar name. When I get enough IP, I will change my name to something better.

Hi!

I started playing League to keep in touch with some friends from when I lived in Minnesota~ The friends I was playing with eventually moved out to LA and for a little while I basically lived in a gaming house, lol. Without them I never would have applied :O

I've been a visual designer at Riot Games for almost 4yrs. (wow!) I think I was visual designer number 3 and now it's a team of all types of designers from interaction and UI to illustration!

You mentioned you're playing ff XIV atm. Have you played any of the other final fantasy games? If so which is your favorite?
Mine is XII, a lot of people hated it {{item:3070}}  but god i had so much fun with it!

I played FFXII right after a 7 year dance with FFXI Online... so, the gameplay was too similar, which is why I stopped playing it. 

FFVI is my favorite, because all the characters were fantastic and the music had really strong melodies. The story also tackled some pretty serious concepts that would be difficult to pull off in modern games... I really like character stories and FFVI had a surprising amount of character development :)
